SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Camera
Represents a 2D camera that defines a viewport into a larger world space.
CraftingManager
Utility class providing crafting functionality based on defined recipes and player inventory.
CraftingManagerTest
 
GameApp
Main application class for the 2D Terraria-like game.
GameLoop
Main game loop that drives updating of game state and rendering of each frame.
InputHandler
Handles user input events: keyboard and mouse interactions.
Inventory
A simple inventory that tracks unique collected items by their IDs.
Inventory
Represents the player's inventory of items, supporting load/save operations and item management (add/remove).
InventoryTest
 
ItemEntity
Represents a single collectible item in the world.
ItemEntityTest
 
ItemType
Defines all collectible item types in the game, each with a unique ID and associated sprite path.
Level
Represents a game level, including the tile map and entity spawn data.
Level.ItemSpawn
Defines a spawn point for an item within the level grid.
Level.NPCSpawn
Defines a spawn point for an NPC within the level grid.
LevelManager
Manages level loading, transitions between levels, and tile operations such as mining and placing.
NPC
Represents a non-player character (NPC) in the game world.
NPCTest
 
Player
Represents the player character in the game world.
PlayerTest
 
Recipe
Represents a crafting recipe, defining the output item and required ingredients.
RecipeLoader
Loads crafting recipes from a resource file with lines in the format:
ResourceLoader
Utility class for loading text resources from the classpath.
SaveLoadManager
Manages saving and loading of game state, including inventory, level index, and player position.
TerrainGenerator
Generates a simple 2D terrain map with a Perlin-like surface profile, layered soil/stone, random caves, trees, autotiled grass edges, and item spawns.
TileConstants
 
TileRegistry
Registry that maps characters from level files to TileType values and loads the corresponding tile textures.
TileType
Defines all types of tiles in the game world, each with properties for solidity, breakability, and an optional texture key for rendering.
UIManager
Manages rendering and user interaction for the game UI, including inventory display, dialogue boxes, pause menu, crafting menu, and win screen.
World
Represents the 2D tile-based world, providing access to tiles, modification (mining/placing), and utility methods for collision and surface queries.
WorldLoader
Utility class for loading level data from resource files.
WorldRenderer
Renders a 2D tile-based world to a JavaFX Canvas.
